author: Jessica Deare
text:
I've sold a good number of items on Vestiaire Collective and everything has always been 100% authentic and compliant.

My issue is that I successfully sold an authentic black Gucci Marmont GG flap bag (Ref: 21546055) on Vestiaire Collective in March this year, and I subsequently sold another authentic yellow Gucci Marmont flap bag in the same size this month. However, the recent order was unexpectedly cancelled by Vestiaire saying: "Our authentication team have carefully examined your item, described as Sac bandoulière GG Marmont Flap en cuir Gucci ref: 22245053. Unfortunately, in applying the criteria involved in this process, we have been unable to verify its authenticity. We are therefore cancelling the sale."

Unfortunately they are not clear as to exactly why this bag was not deemed complaint. What criteria are they even using? I had to contact customer service for clarification and was told by a Rascelle A., "It is declared not authentic that is why the sale got cancelled." Oh really, thanks for the reiteration of the vague e-mail I already received, Rascelle. Which so-called "expert" authenticator deemed my previously sold brand new Gucci bag as "compliant" and this one as "inauthentic"? What wildly inaccurate and arbitrary authentication methods are Vestiaire even using? When I asked more questions the customer service rep simply ended the chat. At least tell me before you go EXACTLY what was deemed false and inauthentic about this bag and not some vague blanket term. 

The two Gucci Marmont bags are from the exact same places and are both authentic. Unfortunately I am now forced to pay €12 to have my item sent back to me, which is even more frustrating knowing without a doubt that my item is absolutely authentic and should have been deemed complaint if the so-called authentication team out in France knew anything about authenticating Gucci bags. This tells me that Vestiaire's authentication team is not at all careful or conscientious when authenticating items as they would like buyers and sellers to believe. 

This recent episode has seriously eroded my trust in Vestiaire Collective and my trust in their authentication team. If they can simply judge authentic items as inauthentic, I have my doubts that they are experts in authentication at all and are really just random amateurs posing as experts.
title: Vestiaire Collective's Authentication Team is Garbage

author: Kimberley Denson
text:
I hate writing bad reviews but this is yet another one.  I purchased in January, was asked by the seller of the bag if they could ship it to be verified in march.  I said OK because I wasn't in a rush.  So I got word it was shipped, verified, but it had issues.  OK, well there was some scratching which wasn't disclosed by the seller.  we had a talk and I was like hmmm...ok.  its probably not that big of a deal right?
well maybe

Anyway Vestiaire supposedly shipped the package March 14, 2022.  And, they kindly provided a fedex shipping tracking number.
OK so I figure give 10 days because of covid and all.
I contacted their customer service on 4/2/2022 because the tracking information changed and I could no longer see any information.  

When I asked about the package they basically told me I needed to provide a driver's license to prove who I was.

Uh, no.  I have an account, I sent the info from my account, you can post it to my account page.  

So today is 4/14/22  I said enough and contacted fedex myself because these folks are not being helpful.
 
I found out from FedEx mind you, that the package that they were to send to me was an empty package.

Empty.

What I find interesting is that she never said the package was damaged because I asked.  She said "It was empty".


For those who packages are in so called limbo and haven't been delivered in weeks, take some time and contact whomever is shipping.  

The customer service portion of all this;  they need to do better.  They had the nerve to ask for a driver's license to track  this package.  Uh no  that info is dead to rights in my account page. And even fedex was like, we don't need that information.  So if you get anyone asking, no, they don't need that.  All they need is the tracking number.

This company has proven themselves to not be trustworthy.

Update:  Now they're harassing the crap out of me, unbelievable.  Being bombarded with the daily emails.  I didn't lose the package, the package never made it to my house.  why they aren't following up with FedEx is beyond me.

1.  They have the tracking number.  Which is the same tracking number they sent to me in email, the same one thats on my account.

2. Shipper (FedEx) validated they got the box and it was empty.

3. Shipper (FedEx) validated they don't send empty boxes and that the box never shipped to me, didn't ship to my neighbors.

3. Shipper(FedEx) validated that Vestiaire should contact them to file the claim not contact me.

4. Shipper(FedEx) is willing to show them the actual empty box.

Escalated to Paypal to get my money back.  They are not willing to call fedex even after I told them multiple times I don't have their product, I never received a box, it never made it to me, its not in my possession, my neighbors don't have it, and I work at home, I would have been here.  They can check easily, they have the info but are refusing to do so (who does this?)

Will never purchase again from this company.  they are awful.

author: Jon Oftedahl
text:
30 minutes after purchasing a €500 bag listed as Loewe Amazona 75 I had a closer look at the 8 photographs of the bag. Compairing with other listings on Vestiaire for Loewe Amazona 75 bags I noticed many differences. I immediately cancelled, but hours later they just shipped it. 

Even if the bag is still in transit from France to Norway customer support insist on getting pictures of the bag when it arrives. They absolutely refuse to use their own photographs of the bag, the very same that I based my purchase on, to compare with genuine Loewe Amazona 75 bags on Vestiaire. 

The bag I bought is not a genuine Loewe Amazona 75, it differs so much. Shape, size, hardware, seams and bottom studs are different. Besides the bag I purchased does not have hardware provisions for a shoulder strap, nor a shoulder strap. The genuine Loewe Amazona 75 bag introduced in 2014 all come with a shoulder strap. 

Why do Vestiaire insist on me sending photographs of the bag when this is not about a minor flaw, but about a bag sold as a Loewe Amazona 75 but being different in so many ways from a genuine? They already have lots of photographs of the bag, it just does not make sense! Googling I can find no photographs of any Loewe bags looking like the one I purchased. Either it is very vintage or it is a bad fake. I expect Vestiaire to solve this matter better than experienced so far.
title: Customer support requirements does not make sense
